description:
Using clean lentils in a pot, sautéd olive oil, onion with salt, then add carrots and start cooking. 
 Add and stir the tomato paste, (3 minutes per step). Now add the cumin, paprika, mint, thyme,then black pepper, and red pepper as quickly as you can and stir again.
 Blend the soupnServe with crushed-up crackers, torn up bread, or something else to add some extra thickness. Enjoy!

Fried chopped onions and minced meat with the salt and pepper. 
 Then a layer of pastry in a baking tray, covered with a thin layer of filling and covered with another layer of filo pastry. 
 When you have 5-6 layers of filling and cover with pastry, cover with filo pastry, bake half an hour and then serve!

Marinated beef in soy sauce, lemon (or calamansi) for 1+ hour, add ground black pepper. 
 Pan-fry the onions until soft. Drain the set aside the marinade from the beef. Pan-fry the beef, then remove it. 
 Saute garlic until softened. Pour the remaining marinade and water. Add the beef. Cover pan and simmer until the meat is tender. 
 Season with ground black pepper and salt as needed. Top with pan-fried onions. Share and Enjoy!

Grind the skinned and soaked beans beans in a food mill, meat grinder, or food processor until they form a paste. 
 Add the scallions, garlic, cilantro, cumin, baking powder, cayenne, salt, pepper, and coriander. 
 Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Shape the bean mixture into 1-inch slightly flattened balls and coat with flour.
 Fry the patties in batches, turning once, until golden brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. 
Remove with a wire mesh skimmer or slotted spoon. Serve as part of a meze or in pita bread with tomato-cucumber salad and tahina sauce.

Mash lots of butter into the potato, then grated cheese. 
There’s other toppings that you can add to your heart’s content, such as sweetcorn, olives, salami, coleslaw, Russian salad, etc. 
You walk away with an over-stuffed potato because you got ever-excited by the choices on offer.
Finely chop one onion and one sweet red pepper.
Put these ingredients into a large bowl with a good sprinkling of salt and pepper, (optionally) chilli flakes.

Combine pork, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, and vegetables, mixed in a bowl.
Separate the wonton skins. Place a heaping teaspoon of filling in the center of the wonton.
Brush water on 2 borders of the skin, covering 1/4 inch from the edge. Fold skin over to form a triangle, sealing edges.
Pinch the two long outside points together. Boil, then drain the water and serve with soy sauce.

diced bacon, add to the pan and cook until it turns golden. Add onion, celery and carrot, and stir-cook until softened.
Add the garlic, stirring and breaking it up with a wooden spoon, until browned all over.
Stir in and cook the tomato purée, mixing the beef and vegetables too. Chop the tomatoes, and add to the pan. Add the honey and season to taste and simmer.
Ladle the ragu sauce into the bottom of the roasting tin or casserole dish, spreading the sauce all over the base. Place 2 sheets of lasagne on top of the sauce overlapping to make it fit, then repeat with more sauce and another layer of pasta. Repeat until done, finishing with a layer of pasta.
Put the crème fraîche and 2 tbsp water mixed in a bowl, pour this over the pasta, then top with the mozzarella. Sprinkle Parmesan over the top and bake uuntil golden and bubbling. Serve scattered with basil, if you like.

Peel and cube potatoes, then fry potatoes until golden brown all over. 
Cut the peppers in half and remove seeds, then grill until the skin is dark and bubbly, and remove skins.
Peel the onions and cut into thin rings, fry until golden brown all over. Add the Ras el hanout.
Cut the pumpkin into cubes and fry until it is soft and slightly browned. 
Put all the cooked vegetables into the pan and mix. Whisk eggs and pour them over the vegetables. Add salt and pepper serve it.

Combine all the ingredients in a bowl, season with salt and chill until the sauce is ready to use.
2. To make the patties, season the mince with salt and pepper and form into balls using about 1/3 cup mince each. Place each onto a square of baking paper and flatten to form into 15cm circles. Fry beef patties until lightly charred and cooked through. 
3. Carefully slice each burger bun into three acrossways, then lightly toast.
4. Spread sauce over the bottom base. Top with some chopped onion, shredded lettuce, slice of cheese, beef patty and some pickle slices. Top with the middle bun layer, and spread with more sauce, onion, lettuce, pickles, beef patty and then finish with more sauce. Top with burger lid to serve.
5. Afterward, go for a jog

Heat oil in a deep fryer or deep heavy skillet to 365°F (185°C). Heat gravy in saucepan or microwave.
Place the fries into the hot oil, and cook until light brown, about 5 minutes.
Remove to a paper towel lined plate to drain. Place the fries on a serving platter, and sprinkle the cheese over them.
Ladle gravy over the fries and cheese, and serve immediately.

Boil the lentils until the lentils are just tender. Drain water and season with a little salt. Now drain the rice from its soaking water. 
Combine the par-cooked lentils and the rice in the saucepan, cook over medium-high heat with cooking oil, salt, pepper, and coriander, stirring regularly. 
Boil water to cover the rice and lentil mixture by about 1 1/2 inches (you’ll probably use about 3 cups of water here). Now cover and cook until all the liquid has been absorbed and both the rice and lentils are well cooked through. 
Now make the pasta by adding the elbow pasta to boiling water with a dash of salt and a little oil, and cook until it is al dente, and drain.
Cover the chickpeas and warm in the microwave briefly before serving.
Make the crispy onion topping. Sprinkle the onion rings with salt, then toss them in the flour to coat. 
Cook the onion rings, until they turn a nice caramelized brown.

Wash and soak toor dal in 3 cups of water, which dal will double in volume after soaking. Drain the water.
Cook dal with 2-1/2 cups water and add salt and turmeric, until soft in texture (it should be like thick soup).
In a frying pan, heat the ghee. Add cumin seeds, and mustard seeds. After the seeds crack, add bay leaves, green chili, ginger and chili powder. Then stir.
Add tomatoes, salt and sugar, then stir and cook until tomatoes are tender and mushy.
Add cilantro and garam masala cook.
Pour the seasoning over dal, mix it well and cook for another minute.Serve with Naan.

Sift together dry ingredients.
Mix together wet ingredients and incorporate into dry. Stir until smooth.
Drop by teaspoonfuls(no bigger) into hot oil (365 degrees, no hotter), turning after a few moments until golden brown on all sides.
Remove and drain.
Roll in cinnamon sugar while still warm and serve.

Put the flour, eggs, milk, 1 tbsp oil and a pinch of salt into a bowl or large jug, then whisk to a smooth batter. 
Set a medium frying pan or crêpe pan over a medium heat and carefully wipe it with some oiled kitchen paper. When hot, cook your pancakes until golden.
Serve with lemon wedges and sugar, or your favourite filling.

Cut the meat into strips, then fry the strips for 6 minutes until it's ready.
Bake the fries until golden brown in a deep fryer, then transfer to a baking dish, spread over the whole dish.
Cover the fries with a new layer of meat and spread evenly.Add a layer of cheese over the meat. You can also use grated cheese. 
When done, put in the oven for a few minutes until the cheese is melted.Chop the lettuce, tomato and cucumber in small pieces and mix together for a salad. 
As extra you can add olives, jalapenos and a red union. Divide the salad over the dish and serve with garlic sauce and hot sauce.

Boil the potatoes in a large pan of salted water until tender. Drain, then mash with 1 tbsp olive oil, then season.
Meanwhile put the milk in a large sauté pan, add the fish and bring to the boil. Remove the fish (reserving the milk) and pat dry with kitchen paper, then gently flake into an ovenproof dish, discarding the skin and any bones.
Heat the remaining oil in a pan, stir in the flour and cook. Gradually stir in the milk. Grate in nutmeg, season, then bubble until thick. Stir in the cream.
Preheat the oven to 190°C/fan170°C/gas. Grate the artichokes and add to the dish with the leek, prawns and herbs. Stir the lemon zest and juice into the sauce, then pour over and mix.
Spoon the mash onto the fish mixture, then use a fork to make peaks, which will crisp and brown as it cooks. Sprinkle over the cheese, then bake until golden and bubbling. Serve with wilted greens.

Sift the flour and salt into the bowl of a food processor, add butter and lard, then whizz together until the mixture looks like fine breadcrumbs. Tip the mixture into a bowl, then stir in the cheese and enough of the water for the mixture to come together. Tip out onto a lightly floured surface and knead briefly until smooth. Roll out thinly and line a bottomed fluted flan tin. Prick the base with a fork, then chil.
Melt 75g of butter in a saucepan over a low heat, then add the leeks and the salt. Cover and cook until soft. Uncover the pan, increase the heat and cook, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has evaporated. Spoon onto a plate and leave to cool.
Preheat the oven to 200°C/fan180°C/gas. Line the pastry case with baking paper, and bake until the edges are biscuit-coloured. Remove the paper, and return the case to the oven until the base is crisp and lightly golden. Remove and set aside. r
Put the crème fraîche into a bowl with the whole egg, egg yolks and nutmeg. Lightly beat together, then season. Stir in the leeks. Spoon the mixture into the tart case and bake until set and lightly golden. Remove from the oven, take out of the tin and serve.

Combine the marinade ingredients in a large ziplock bag for 24+ hours.
Add the chicken and then massage the bag to disperse the rub all over each chicken piece.
Combine the Yoghurt Sauce ingredients in a bowl and mix. Cover and put in the fridge.
Heat grill/BBQ (or large heavy based pan on stove) on medium high.Place chicken on the grill and cook until nicely charred, then turn and cook the other side .
Remove chicken from the grill and cover loosely with foil.
Slice chicken and pile onto a platter alongside flatbreads, Salad and the Yoghurt Sauce.To make a wrap, get a piece of flatbread and smear with Yoghurt Sauce. Top with a bit of lettuce and tomato and Chicken Shawarma. Roll up and enjoy!

For the rice, heat the oil in a large, lidded pan, add the onion, then gently fry until softened but not coloured. Add the spices, season with salt, then continue to fry until it becomes brown and fragrant.
Add the rice and stir in well. Add 600ml water, stir, then bring to the boil, then reduce to a simmer. Take off the heat and leave to stand. The rice will be perfectly cooked if you do not lift the lid before the end of the cooking.
Meanwhile, put the haddock and bay leaves in a frying pan, cover with the milk, then poach until the flesh flakes. Remove from the milk, peel away the skin, then flake the flesh into thumb size pieces. Place the eggs in a pan, cover with water, bring to the boil, then reduce to a simmer. Plunge into cold water, then peel and cut the eggs into quarters. Gently mix the fish, eggs, parsley, coriander and rice together in the pan. Serve hot, sprinkled with a few extra herbs.

Wash and peel the potatoes and cut into similarly sized pieces for even cooking.In a large soup pot, boil the potatoes and the bay leaves in salted water. Discard the bay leaves.
Peel and chop the shallots. In a frying pan or skillet, melt 1 tbsp. of butter and saute the shallots for a few minutes before adding the curly kale and 2 tbsp. of water. 
Season and cook until tender.Warm the milk on the stove or in the microwave.
Drain, shake and dry the potatoes with kitchen towels before mashing with a potato masher or ricer. Working quickly, add the warm milk and the remaining butter. Season to taste with nutmeg, salt, and pepper. 
Mix the cooked curly kale through the cooked mashed potato mixture.
Top with slices of the smoked sausage and serve hot with your favorite mustard or gravy. Serve and enjoy!

Brown the beef in a deep ovenproof frying pan over a high heat. Meanwhile, prick the aubergine with a fork, then microwave until soft. 
Mix the yogurt, egg and parmesan together, then add a little seasoning.
Stir the tomatoes, purée and potatoes in with the beef with some seasoning and heat through. 
Smooth the surface of the beef mixture with the back of a spoon, then slice the cooked aubergine and arrange on top. Pour the yogurt mixture over the aubergines, smooth out evenly, then grill until the topping has set and turned golden.

Heat the oil in a frying pan that has a lid, then soften the onions, chili, garlic and coriander stalks until soft. Stir in the tomatoes and sugar, then bubble until thick. 
Using the back of a large spoon, make 4 dips in the sauce, then crack an egg into each one. Put a lid on the pan, then cook over a low heat until the eggs are done to your liking. Scatter with the coriander leaves and serve with crusty bread.

Grease a 9-inch pie dish.Place the brown sugar and butter in a mixing bowl, and beat them together with an electric mixer until creamy and very well combined without lumps. 
Beat in eggs, one at a time, before adding the next one. Add the vanilla extract and salt; beat the flour in, a little at a time, and then the milk, making a creamy batter. Pour the batter into the prepared pie dish.
Bake in the preheated oven (350 degrees F or 175 degrees C) for 35 minutes; remove pie, and cover the rim with aluminum foil to prevent burning. Return to the oven, and bake until the middle sets and the top forms a crusty layer, about 15 more minutes. Enjoy!

Put 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large pot over medium heat. When it’s hot, add onion, carrot, celery and garlic. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are soft.
Preheat the oven to 500 degrees. Drain the beans; if they’re canned, rinse them as well. Add them to the pot along with tomatoes and their juices and stock, rosemary and thyme. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat so the soup bubbles steadily; cover and cook, stirring to break up the tomatoes, until the flavors melt.
Fish out and discard rosemary and thyme stems, and stir in kale. Taste and adjust seasoning. Lay bread slices on top of the stew so they cover the top and overlap as little as possible. Scatter red onion slices over the top, drizzle with the remaining 3 tablespoons of oil and sprinkle with Parmesan.
Put the pot in the oven and bake until the bread, onions and cheese are browned and crisp. Divide the soup and bread among 4 bowls and serve.
